instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT is the voltage rail for the backlight of the LCD screen. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spotlight effect on half of LCD
threads.message:
LCD as pictured with alternating dim LED's on left half of screen.

Backlight driver looked suspect so I replaced it, there was some corrosion on the LVDS connector so I replaced that too.
No change in the issue, I tried connecting a different LCD and it persists so it's not the LCD or cable itself.

<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>:  24.7
<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>:  24.7
<SIGNAL>LED_RETURN_6</SIGNAL>: 4.7
<SIGNAL>LED_RETURN_5</SIGNAL>: 1.6
<SIGNAL>LED_RETURN_4</SIGNAL>: 1.6
<SIGNAL>LED_RETURN_3</SIGNAL>: 1.6
<SIGNAL>LED_RETURN_2</SIGNAL>: 1.6
<SIGNAL>LED_RETURN_1</SIGNAL>: 1.6

Any ideas what to check?

Best Regards
S.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spotlight effect on half of LCD
threads.message: One of these led returns is not like the other

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spotlight effect on half of LCD
threads.message:
I wasn't sure if <SIGNAL>LED_RETURN_6</SIGNAL> was high or all the others were low, but I suppose its more logical its just <SIGNAL>LED_RETURN_6</SIGNAL> thats the issue.
the <SIGNAL>BKL_ISEN6</SIGNAL> pad was in good shape and the ball looks good, the only pad on the driver that looked iffy was the center <SIGNAL>TP_BKL_FAULT</SIGNAL> Is it possible that could be causing this issue?
I already replaced <RESISTOR>R9722</RESISTOR>, no change.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spotlight effect on half of LCD
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> spotlight effect on half of LCD
threads.message:
Diode was going to .0L and <SIGNAL>BKL_ISEN6</SIGNAL> doesn't go back further then <CHIP>U9701</CHIP>, finally accepted the fact it must be the trace in between. Ran a jumper wire from Pin-21 <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> to <RESISTOR>R9722</RESISTOR> and it works perfectly.
Many Thanks.
